スーツには鉱脈の大まかな位置が表示されますが、地中に埋まった鉱石を
さらけ出すためには[fff400]インベントリに鉱石スキャナを置いておく[-]必要があります!

[u]暗視ゴーグル:[/u]
 [fff400](L)[-]を二回押すと、暗視ゴーグルのOn/Offが出来ます。
また、これはバイクや宇宙船などの操縦中にも動作します!
バイクを探す

English:
[f98009][IDA][-]

This bike will work best when the environment is not too hilly.

[fff400]Move it to a free slot on your toolbar for placing it later on![-]
japanese(翻訳):
[f98009][IDA][-]

このバイクは、割と平坦な場所で最も最適に使えます。

[fff400]あとで設置するために、ツールバーの空いたスロットに置いておきましょう![-]
格納庫扉Bを開く

English: [f98009][IDA][-] Now find the Lever to open the Hangar doors.
japanese(翻訳): [f98009][IDA][-] 格納庫扉を開けるためのレバーを探しましょう。
格納庫扉Bのレバーを探す

English: [f98009][IDA][-] Open the Hangar door.\n\nThen we'll [fff400]drive over to the large stones[-] next to the PERIMETER BEACON for a quick drilling test.
japanese(翻訳): [f98009][IDA][-]格納庫扉を開けてください。\n\n次に、掘削テストを行うために境界ビーコンの横にある[fff400]岩石地帯まで運転[-]してください。
格納庫扉を開ける
ドリルをテストする

English:
[f98009][IDA][-]

Move the bike to your toolbar and select the slot.
Then place the bike on the ground with a [ff2400]Left Mouse Button click[-]

Face the bike and mount it by pressing [ff2400](F)[-].

Use W,S,A,D to drive.

Move the Mouse to change the camera viewpoint.

You can pick up the bike (and other terrain-placeables)
 by facing the bike and then using [ff2400]SHIFT + F.[-]
japanese(翻訳):
[f98009][IDA][-]

ツールバーにバイクを移動して、そのスロットを選択してください。
次に[ff2400]左クリック[-]でバイクを設置してください。

バイクに向かって[ff2400](F)[-]でバイクに乗ります。

W、A、S、Dで運転します。

マウスを動かすと、カメラ視点を変更できます。

バイク(や地形上に設置可能なその他)に向かって[ff2400]SHIFT + F[-]で回収できます。
ビーコンに向かって移動
露天掘り

English:
[f98009][IDA][-]

Now get off the bike and select the toolbar slot
where you put either of the Drills.

With the drill in your hands [ff2400]Right Mouse click[-]
will bring up the [ff2400]MODE SELECTION[-].

Set the mode to [fff400]STONE REMOVAL[-] with a [ff2400]Left Mouse click.[-]

Then drill into some of the larger stones by holding
[ff2400]Left Mouse button[-] and [fff400]watch the lower LEFT screen[-] if ore is picked up.

Not all stones contain ore or the same amount of ore.
japanese(翻訳):
[f98009][IDA][-]

バイクを降りて、ドリルを置いたツールバースロットを選択してください。

ドリルを手にして[ff2400]右クリック[-]で[ff2400]モード選択[-]が表示されます。

[fff400]岩石破壊[-]モードで[ff2400]左クリック[-]するとセットされます。

そして岩石に向けて[ff2400]マウス左ボタン[-]を押しっぱなしにすると岩石を掘り始め、
何らかの鉱石が得られたなら[fff400]画面左下[-]に表示されます。

全ての岩石が同じ種類、同じ量の鉱石が埋蔵しているわけではありません。
鉱石を7個拾う

English: [f98009][IDA][-] Nearly all common ores can be retrieved from small and large surface stones!
japanese(翻訳): [f98009][IDA][-] ほとんどすべての一般的な鉱石は、地表にある大小の岩石から回収できます!
プロメシウムを探す

English:
[f98009][IDA][-]

Well done. Mount your bike again.

I've marked a [fff400]nearby Promethium deposit[-] on your screen.
japanese(翻訳):
[f98009][IDA][-]

お疲れ様です。 またバイクに乗ってください。

画面上に[fff400]近くのプロメシウム鉱脈[-]を表示しました。
鉱脈に行く
[i]…ある日～月をドライブしてたら～♪…[/i]
プロメシウムを掘る

English:
[f98009][IDA][-]

Get off your bike and [fff400]select a drill from the toolbar[-].

This will activate the ore scanner.

The scanner will detect ore in a [ff2400]40m radius[-], by displaying [428bca]blue outlines of the ore rocks[-]
(or green ones with Night Vision active) below the ground.

The outlines are [fff400]thicker if you are closer[-] to an ore rock.

Make sure the drill is set to [ff2400]RESOURCE MINING[-].

Start drilling down and into the rocks until they are picked up.

Don't forget to check your [fff400]food bar[-] once in a while!
japanese(翻訳):
[f98009][IDA][-]

バイクを降りて、また[fff400]ドリルを選択[-]してください。

すると鉱石スキャナが作動します。

このスキャナは[ff2400]半径40m[-]以内にある地中の[428bca]鉱石を青い輪郭で表示[-]
(暗視ゴーグル使用中は緑色)します。

輪郭線は鉱石に[fff400]近づくと太く[-]なります。

ドリルモードが[ff2400]資源採掘[-]になっていることを確認してください。

掘り下げていって掘り当てたら、鉱石を得られるまで掘り続けてください。

その間、[fff400]食料ゲージ[-]の減りに注意してください!
プロメシウムを80個掘る
ペンタキシドを探す

English:
[f98009][IDA][-]

We now need to [fff400]find a Pentaxid resource.[-]

Mount your bike and drive towards the [fff400]Service Station[-] marked on your screen.

[u]To get out of the hole[/u], activate your [ff2400]Jetpack (J)[-], then press [ff2400](Space)[-] to jump.

Watch the [fff400]Jetpack-Reload indicator[-] on the lower LEFT side of the screen.
You might need to wait a few seconds for the Jetpack to load up again.

Of course you can jump higher in low-gravity environments!

If you drilled straight down, you might need to carve out
ramps and ledges with your drill in order to get out of the mine.
japanese(翻訳):
[f98009][IDA][-]

今度は[fff400]ペンタキシド資源を探す[-]必要があります。

バイクに乗り、画面に表示されている[fff400]サービスステーション[-]へ向かってください。

[u]穴から出るためには[/u]、[ff2400]ジェットパック(J)[-]を有効化し、
ジャンプ[ff2400](Space)[-]してください。

左下の[fff400]ジェットパック・リロードゲージ[-]を見てください。
ジェットパックが再び使えるようになるまで数秒かかることもあるでしょう。

当然のことですが、低重力環境ならもっと高く飛ぶことができます!

もしまっすぐ掘り下げてしまった場合、その坑道から出るには
ドリルで坂や岩棚を掘る必要があります。
調査地点
ペンタキシドを採取する

English:
[f98009][IDA][-]

Oh, a Crystal field. Seems like the scientists finally managed to grow those crystals.

If my data is correct, those surface [fff400]crystals will regrow[-] after having been harvested.
Might take some time, though.

In order to [fff400]harvest the crystals[-] just approach one and pick it up with [ff2400](F)[-].

Do not forget to [fff400]pick up your bike[-] by pointing at it and pressing [ff2400]SHIFT + F[-]!
japanese(翻訳):
[f98009][IDA][-]

あぁ、結晶畑ですか。 
科学者たちはついにこれらの結晶の育成を成し遂げたようですね。

私のデータが正しければ、それらは収穫しても[fff400]結晶は再成長[-]します。
時間はかかるでしょうけれど。

[fff400]結晶を収穫[-]するには、うち一つに近づいて採取[ff2400](F)[-]してください。

バイクに向かって[ff2400]SHIFT + F[-]で[fff400]バイクを回収[-]するのを忘れないでください!
ペンタキシドを1つ採取する
ペンタキシドをもっと採取する

English:
[f98009][IDA][-]

Hold [ff2400](Shift)[-] to sprint, but watch your STAMINA bar on the lower left!

[fff400]Note:[-] STAMINA recovers slowly when walking at normal speed,
faster while standing still and instantly when either consuming drinks
and medicines - or when using furniture like beds, couches, etc.

[ff2400]Important:[-]
If you run, you will use up O2 faster and your food-level will drop faster!
japanese(翻訳):
[f98009][IDA][-]

[ff2400](Shift)[-]を押し続けると走りますが、左下のスタミナゲージに気をつけてください!

[fff400]注意:[-] スタミナは通常速度で歩いている時にはゆっくりと、
静かに立っている時は早く、飲み物や薬を消費すれば直ぐに回復します。
ベッドやソファーその他の家具を使うことでも回復できます。

[ff2400]重要:[-]
走っていると、より早く酸素を使い果たし、空腹に近づくでしょう!
ペンタキシドを2つ採取する

English:
[f98009][IDA][-]

There's a Hover Vessel parked nearby the Service Station.
Let's make use of it.

[ff2400]First, pick up some BioFuel from the container in the service station.[-]

While you're at it, you may also want to [fff400]fill up your suit O2[-] by [fff400]using the O2 Station[-].
japanese(翻訳):
[f98009][IDA][-]

サービスステーションの近くにホバー(Hover Vessel)がありますね。
使わせてもらいましょう。

[ff2400]まず、サービスステーションのコンテナからバイオ燃料を取って来てください。[-]

それから[fff400]O2ステーションを使って[-]、[fff400]スーツの酸素タンクを満タンに[-]するのも良いでしょう。
サービスステーション
コンテナに行く
燃料を取る
O2ステーションを使用する
ホバー船

English: [f98009][IDA][-] Go to the Hover Vessel, [fff400]aim at the cockpit[-] and press [ff2400](F)[-] to have a seat.\n\nAfter getting inside, press [ff2400](P)[-] to bring up the Control Panel.
japanese(翻訳): [f98009][IDA][-] ホバー船まで行き、[fff400]コクピットに合わせて[-][ff2400](F)[-]で乗り込んでください。\n\n乗り込めたらコントロールパネル[ff2400](P)[-]を開いてください。
コントロールパネル

English: [f98009][IDA][-] Now click the button [fff400]MANAGE[-] below the FUEL section.
japanese(翻訳): [f98009][IDA][-] 燃料セクションの[fff400]管理[-]ボタンを押してみましょう。
燃料タンクを管理する

English: [f98009][IDA][-] [ff2400]Drag & drop[-] or [ff2400]SHIFT + Left mouse click[-] the BioFuel to the [fff400]FILL FUEL[-] intake.\n\nThen exit the screen.
japanese(翻訳): [f98009][IDA][-] [ff2400]ドラッグ & ドロップ[-] か [ff2400]SHIFT + 左クリック[-]してバイオ燃料を [fff400]補給[-] してください。\n\nそうしたら管理画面を抜けましょう。
ホバー船を管理する
コントロールパネルを閉じる
ホバー船を起動させる
[f98009][IDA][-] 船を起動[ff2400](Y)[-]してください。
エンジン始動
採掘拠点に戻る

English:
[f98009][IDA][-]

Let's head back to the Mining Hub.

[ff2400]Drive with W,A,S,D.[-]
You can lower and raise hover height with [ff2400]C and SPACE[-].

Use [ff2400](V)[-] to switch to external view.
Use [ff2400]ALT[-] to undock camera and [ff2400]move the mouse[-] for using the FREELOOK (works in 1st person as well!)
Use [ff2400]Page UP/Down[-] to raise or lower camera position in 3rd person.
Use [ff2400]mousewheel[-] to increase or reduce camera distance to the vessel.
While having the camera undocked, use the [ff2400]Arrow keys[-] to move and turn the vessel.

If you accidentally flip your vessel upside down, tap [ff2400]SHIFT[-] once to uprighten it again.

If you have a NIGHTVISION, tap the [ff2400]L button twice[-] to activate it!
japanese(翻訳):
[f98009][IDA][-]

採掘拠点に戻りましょう。

[ff2400]W、A、S、Dで運転[-]します。
ホバーの高さは[ff2400]Cで下がり、SPACEで上がり[-]ます。

[ff2400](V)[-]を押すと外観カメラに切り替わります。
[ff2400]ALT[-] を押すとカメラ操作が独立し、[ff2400]マウスを動かして[-]自由に見回せるようになります(一人称視点でも!)。 
三人称視点の時に[ff2400]Page UP/Down[-]でカメラ位置を上下できます。
 自由視点時に[ff2400]マウスホイール[-]でカメラと乗り物との距離を調整できます。
自由視点の時は、[ff2400]矢印キー[-]で船が動かせます

誤って船が裏返しになってしまったら、[ff2400]SHIFT[-]を一回押してみてください。

暗視ゴーグルを持っているなら、[ff2400]Lを二回押し[-]で使えます!
ホバーを運転する
手助け

English:
[f98009][IDA][-] [fbb26b]The Chief Scientist of Apollon was just calling. He said they do not need any additional Promethium or Pentaxid for the Warp Drive material testing, but appreciate your efforts.[-]

Hm..let me guess, they left some in the scanner again...
Anyway. I don't want to be called a liar, when promising cake.

[f98009][IDA][-] [fbb26b]That's very nice of you, considering the Laboratory also sent me an urgent request for your assistance in the same message.[-]

One of those days, I guess...
japanese(翻訳):
[f98009][IDA][-] [fbb26b]アポロンの科学者チーフから連絡です。
ワープドライブの素材テストにプロメチウムとペンタキシドは不要、
ですがあなたの働きに感謝、とのことです。[-]

ふむ…スキャナにいくらか残ったのかもしれないな…。
まあいい。とにかく、ケーキを嘘にしたくない。

[f98009][IDA][-] [fbb26b]お優しいことですね、研究所からも同じメッセージで緊急要請が送られてきたことを考慮すれば。[-]

まったく、今日は厄日だよ…
事務官
中に入る
事務官と話す

English:
[00dfff][Officer]

Hey Chief! Your IDA just added a request for some baking ingredients.

I don't have them here, but if you can do me a favor
and [fff400]repair the Greenhouse in the crater[-], I will make sure you get the
permission to harvest the crops grown there![-]

Ok, sounds like a fair deal. What shall I do first?

[00dfff] First you should [fff400]smelt ore into ingots[-] in our furnace.
It's located [fff400]upstairs behind the office building[-].[-]
japanese(翻訳):
[00dfff][事務官]

やあチーフ!あなたのIDAがパン焼き材料のリクエストを追加してきましたよ。

ここにはありませんが、[fff400]クレーターにある温室の修理[-]をしてもらえたら、
そこで栽培された作物を収穫する許可を出しましょう、どうです?[-]

OK、いい取引だな。まず何をすればいい?

[00dfff] まずはここの溶鉱炉で[fff400]鉱石をインゴットに精錬[-]する必要があります。
溶鉱炉は[fff400]向こうの階段を上がって、このビルの裏手[-]にありますよ。[-]
オフィスビル
溶鉱炉に行く

English: [f98009][IDA][-] The furnace is located in the next building.
japanese(翻訳): [f98009][IDA][-] 溶鉱炉は次の建物の中ですね。
溶鉱炉へ

English: [f98009][IDA][-] Go through the red door, point at the furnace and press [ff2400](F)[-].
japanese(翻訳): [f98009][IDA][-] 赤い扉を通って、溶鉱炉に合わせて[ff2400](F)[-]です。
溶鉱炉
溶鉱炉に近づく

English: [f98009][IDA][-] There is some ore left, but I suggest you drop all the ores from your inventory into the furnace INPUT as well. \n\n[ff2400]Switch furnace to ON with the slider on the top right.[-]
japanese(翻訳):
[f98009][IDA][-] 鉱石が残っていますが、インベントリの全ての鉱石を
溶鉱炉の入力欄に収めるよう提案します。

[ff2400]右上のスライダーをONに切り替えてください。[-]
溶鉱炉を使う

English:
[f98009][IDA][-]

Now let's wait until all the ore is processed. This will take only a few seconds.

[fff400]Pick up all the INGOTS from the furnace OUTPUT as soon as the smelting is completed and exit the furnace.[-]

Note: Stacks smaller than 5 cannot be processed.

If you get a [ff2400]Heat warning[-] while standing close to the furnace,
make [fff400]use of the shower on the left[-] to cool down your body temperature!

Watch the [ff2400]Temp and RAD Info on the top right screen[-] to avoid this!
japanese(翻訳):
[f98009][IDA][-]

鉱石の処理を待ちましょう。ほんの数秒しかかかりません。

[fff400]精錬が完了したらすぐに溶鉱炉の出力欄からインゴットを取り出して、
ここを出ましょう。[-]

注意:鉱石は5個ずつでしか処理できません。

もし溶鉱炉の近くに居すぎて[ff2400]暑すぎる[-]症状が出たら、
[fff400]左にあるシャワーを使って[-]身体を冷やしましょう!

その予防のために[ff2400]画面右上にある温度や放射線情報[-]に気を配りましょう!
鉱石の精錬
インゴットを取る
フードプロセッサー

English:
[00dfff][Officer][-]

Well done. You might need to create a few [fff400]Growing Plots[-] next.
Use the FOOD PROCESSOR to create the [fff400]Nutrient Solution[-] component.
japanese(翻訳):
[00dfff][事務官][-]

ご苦労様。 次にいくつかの[fff400]栽培区画(農地)[-]を作ってもらいます。
まずはフードプロセッサーを使って[fff400]栄養液[-]を作ってください。
フードプロセッサーへ行く

English: [00dfff][Officer][-] I've already added the necessary ingredients.\n\n[ff2400]Access code: 7777[-]
japanese(翻訳): [00dfff][事務官][-]必要な材料は既に入っていますよ。\n\n[ff2400]アクセスコード:7777 [-]
フードプロセッサーのアクセス｜コード 7777

English: [00dfff][Officer][-] I suggest to craft at least [fff400]3x Nutrient Solution![-]
japanese(翻訳): [00dfff][事務官][-]少なくとも[fff400]栄養液を3つ[-]作っておくといいですよ!
栄養液
栄養液を三つ作る

English: [f98009][IDA][-] Move the Nutrient Solution to your inventory - then let's go to the Constructors.
japanese(翻訳): [f98009][IDA][-] 栄養液をインベントリに移したら、コンストラクタに行きましょう。
インベントリに移す
ワークショップ

English: [f98009][IDA][-] The [fff400]constructors can also smelt some ores into ingots[-], but the furnace can do it faster.\n\nOn the flip side: unlike the constructors, the furnace can not process temperature-sensitve materials like Magnesium, Promethium, Pentaxid and Crushed Stones.
japanese(翻訳):
[f98009][IDA][-] [fff400]コンストラクタでもインゴットを精錬できます[-]が、
溶鉱炉のほうが短時間ですみます。

一方で、コンストラクタと違い、溶鉱炉では
マグネシウム、プロメチウム、ペンタキシド、岩石など熱に弱い素材は処理できません。
コンストラクタへ行く
アンロック

English:
[f98009][IDA][-]

Before we can start, we need to [fff400]unlock the Multitool[-].

Open the Blueprint Menu with [ff2400](F3)[-], go to the [fff400]TOOLS[-] tab and [fff400]select the Multitool[-].

Hit UNLOCK on the upper right to add the template to your repository.

NOTE:
For unlocking devices, weapons and tools (both including their ammo), different amounts
of UNLOCK POINTS are required. These are acquired by leveling up.
japanese(翻訳):
[f98009][IDA][-]

その前に、[fff400]マルチツールをアンロック[-]してしまいましょう。

テックツリーを開き[ff2400](F3)[-]、 [fff400]ツール[-]タブに行って[fff400]マルチツールを選択[-]してください。

右上のアンロックボタンを押すと、テンプレートが追加されます。

注意:
デバイスや武器、ツールなどはそれぞれ異なる量のアンロックポイントを必要とします。
これらはレベルアップで獲得できます。
弾薬はその武器をアンロックすることで作れるようになります。
マルチ･ツールをアンロック
コンストラクタ
[f98009][IDA][-]\n\nさあ、コンストラクタ[ff2400](F)[-]を開きましょう。
コンストラクタを開く
コンストラクタを埋める

English: [f98009][IDA][-] Move all the [fff400]Ingots, Promethium[-] and the [fff400]Nutrient Solution[-] to the constructor INPUT!
japanese(翻訳): [f98009][IDA][-][fff400]インゴット、プロメシウム[-]、それに[fff400]栄養液[-]をコンストラクタに収めてください!
材料を追加
制作発注の準備

English: [f98009][IDA][-] We need to create at least [fff400]3x Growing Plot (Concrete), 3x Window Blocks L[-] from the [u]BUILDING BLOCKS[/u] tab, as well as [fff400]1x Multitool T1[-] and [fff400]1x Multi Charge[-] from the [u]TOOLS & WEAPONS[/u] tab. Use the [fff400]Icons on the top right[-], above the TEMPLATE headline to switch between the TABs\n[ff2400]Select the templates from the list on the right[-]
japanese(翻訳):
[f98009][IDA][-] 私達は少なくとも、[u]建設ブロック[/u]タブから

A small vessel (SV) or hover vessel (HV) blueprint can only be
spawned on either a Base or a Capital Vessel!
A captial vessel (CV) blueprint can only be spawned on a Base

 the blueprint wireframe will AUTO-ALIGN iself to the surface.

English:

English:
[i]Q: I died and dropped a backpack – how does this work?[/i]
- A backpack will drop with your inventory stuff included. A small flag will be shown on your Radar Map (top right).
- Your backpack will vanish after 15 Minutes if you or someone else does not pick it up.
- Backpacks can be looted by anyone. They are not protected either in PvE nor PvP worlds.

[i]Q: How do I swim?[/i]
Empty your hands to swim. If you hold a weapon or tool in your hands, you will sink to the ground.

[i]Q: What is the 'faction' setting in the Control Panel all about?[/i]
You can set a faction and decide who can use your stuff: 
- Public = anyone can use/work on it with tools
- Public = only Owner can use / work on it with tools
- Faction = only Faction members can use /work on it with tools

- 誰も拾わないでいると、バックパックは15分後に消滅します。
- バックパックはPvEやPvPの世界では保護されておらず、誰でも奪えます。

[i] Q:なんか泳げないんだけど…?[/i]
 A:素手で泳ぎます。手に武器やツールを持っていると沈むでしょう。

[i] Q:コントロールパネルの「ファクション」設定って何ですか?[/i]
 A:派閥と、あなたのものを使うことができる人を決めます:
- パブリック = 誰でも利用・ツール使用可。
- プライベート = オーナーのみが利用・ツール使用可。
- ファクション = その派閥メンバーのみが利用・ツール使用可。

オフライン・プロテクト

English:
[i]Q: How does the Offline Protection work?[/i]
- If you have equipped a Capital Vessel or a BA with the Offline Protection Device, and your Base or Capital Vessel is either set to your faction, this will activate a shield when you leave the server. Your BA or Capital Vessel does NOT need to be powered and it does not use up fuel packs! 
- The OP has a timer that can be set by the Admin. Default setting is 48 real-time hours (2 days). 
- For factions with more than one member, the OP activates only if ALL faction members have left the server.

- 保護機能には管理者が設定できるタイマーがあります。 デフォルト設定は48リアルタイム時間(2日間)です。
- 複数のメンバーがいる派閥の場合、すべての派閥メンバーがサーバーから退出した場合にのみ保護が有効化されます。

English:
[i]Q: How to use the ALT-look Mode?[/i]
- Hit V to switch to the 3rd Person view. Then hit ALT only ONCE and the camera view gets un-docked from your Player Avatar or Vessel. Use the mouse to move the camera view. Use the mouse wheel to zoom in and out
- You can still walk/fly by using the Arrow-Keys and the WASD +Q/E commands
- The ALT-look mode also works in 1st Person, for example when sitting in a Cockpit!

PvP vs PvE

English:
[i]Q: What is the difference between PvP and PvE planets/orbits?[/i]
When you open the map (M) you can see a list of planets and orbits. Click on one of them and you'll notice a green PvE or red PvP. This is more relevant for Multiplayer, though. 

- [u]PvE:[/u] No other players can damage you or your vessel or base with weapons or tools. Only Alien drones and Alien creatures can do so. Vice-versa: you can destroy Alien bases with your weapons (but NOT with tools!) and any wildlife.

[u]There is only one exception:[/u] As soon as you destroy the Core of an Alien POI and/or swap it with your own Base Core, the blocks of the structure are becoming immune to weapon fire. You need to work on this former Alien POI with the Remove & Repair tool.

- [u]PvP:[/u] Anything goes. You or your structures are NOT protected in any way as long as you are online. Build an Offline Protection device to protect your PvP-Bases and Capital Vessels while you are offline.

- [u] PvE:[/u]他のプレイヤーはあなたはもちろん、あなたの船や基地に武器や道具で傷つけることはできません。 エイリアンドローンやエイリアンクリーチャーだけがそうすることができます。 あなたもツールではなく武器でエイリアン基地を破壊したり、野生生物を殺せます。

[u]1つだけ例外があります:[/u]エイリアンPOIのコアを破壊したり、自分のベースコアと交換すると、その構造物のブロックはあなたの武器の影響をうけなくなります。その元エイリアンPOIの修復・破壊はマルチツールで作業をする必要があります。

English:
[i[Q: What do the 2x3 number blocks aka environmental info below the radar minimap want to tell me?[/i]
A1: The upper block is the TEMPERATURE. The big number on the left is the temperature at your CURRENT POSITION. The small upper number is your current BODY TEMPERATURE. The small lower number is only shown if you are inside a base or vessel. This is telling you the OUTSIDE TEMPERATURE. If you are outside a base or vessel, this is of course the same as the CURRENT LOCATION temp (and thus removed from the HUD to reduce confusion)
A2: The lower block is the RADIATION. The big number on the left side is the radiation level on your CURRENT POSITION. The small upper number is yoour BODY RADIATION level. The small lower number is the OUTSIDE RADIATION. Same principle as with temperature: The latter is only shown when you are inside a vessel or a base and is removed if you are outside.

[i]Q: How does Temperature work in general?[/i]
A1: Each Planet has a MAX and MIN temperature. The max temperature is reached at 5 pm and the min temperature at 5 am. If you go higher up in the air, the temperature will decrease. Your suit will protect you from extreme temperatures - depending on its TempMIN/MAX protection. (Can be enhanced by Boosters).
A2: Space always has -270°C for most orbits (except a few) and is not suitable for ANY of the current suits for a longer stay (unboosted)

[i]Q: Am i protected from high/low temperatures inside a base or vessel?[/i]
If it is activated, yes. If a station or vessel is powered, the temperature is heated up to 22-25° (Same for enclosed cockpits for SV and HV). So you are fine even with your interior suit. BUT this will not happen instantly! If your base is cooled to space temperature, it might take quite a while to heat up to a suitable temperature! No instant-heat-up!

[i]Q: What happens if i am outside with a suit that can not protect me from high/low temperatures?[/i]
A1: If the temperature is higher or lower as your protection level, your body temp will slowly rise (or fall) towards the temperature at your current position. At a certain temperature, you will start to feel cold/heated up.
A2: If it is too cold or hot outside, just go back into your base or vessel. This will heat up/cool down your body temp. BUT THIS DOES NOT HAPPEN INSTANTLY. If this takes too long, you'll of course die.
A3: Tip: there are some foods and beverages that increase/decrease body temperature!

[i]Q: Does a hull breach lead to the temperature dropping inside a base or vessel?[/i]A: Yes!

English:
[i]Q: What do i need to oxygenate a base or vessel?[/i]
A1: You need an O2 tank and a ventilator. And your base needs to be powered.
A2: Place the ventilator in each room that you want to be oxygenated and add some O2 to the O2 tank. Open the control panel. Activate the base and tick the checkbox 'O2'. This will fill up all the rooms with a ventilator with O2 - given your O2 capacity is high enough. The ventilator needs to be 'active' of course.
A3: Open the console and type in 'help oxygen' to show info on how to visualize O2 level (debug mode)
A4: If your O2 capacity/filling status is too low to oxygenate your base, the process will fail. Add more O2 Tanks or O2.

[i]Q: How long does it take for a large room to be filled with O2?[/i]
This happens pretty instant (maybe a second or two)

[i]Q: How do i know how much O2 i need to fill all the rooms that are connected?[/i]
When having placed a ventilator, the Control Panel will give you an answer > look for the OXYGEN stats in the lower right corner. There you'll find something like this: OXYGEN N:166 T:834 R:166

N = Needed O2 to pressurize. That's the amount of O2 you need to have in your tanks ( T )
T = Total O2 left in tanks. Pressurizing removes the amount of shown for 'N' from the total amount. The amount left is reduced by respiration of players in your base (Helmet off) over time
R = O2 currently used/blocked by ventilators (0 = no room oxygenated)

Usecases:
- If N<T, your base can not be oxygenated. Add more tanks and O2
- If T=0, the 'free O2' is gone and the base will automatically deoxygenate. This will move the amount of O2, which was blocked by the ventilators (figure R) back to the tanks. (If there is enough room)
- If you deoxygenate your base manually, the amount of figure R will be moved back to the tanks. If there is not enough room in your O2 tanks, the excess is lost.
- If a hull breach happens, the O2 in this room is lost, BUT the vents will not try to refill the affected room! So the ventilator is still active, but will not waste precious O2.

English:
[i]Q: Are oxygenated rooms available for all vessels and structures?[/i]
Yes!

[i]Q: Do i consume less O2 when i am in an oxygenated room with helmet off compared to helmet equipped?[/i]
Yes! But you even use up your suit O2 less fast if your helmet is still unfolded in an oxygenated base.

[i]Q: Are there different pressure levels?[/i]
No. The atmosphere in a room either has O2 or not.

[i]Q: Which blocks are airtight?[/i]
A: Have a look at the block info panel for infos about airtight value. Most of the doors are airtight for example - but not all. Airtight doors have a blue containment field active while sealing a room

[i]Q: Can i switch off the containment field of a door to let O2 flow?[/i]
Not yet.

[i]Q: What happens if i open a door? Will O2 flow in the next room?[/i]
Basically no. There are non-airtight doors that do not hinder the flow of O2 either open or closed. All other doors (including hangar doors, shutter doors) have a sealing field to keep the O2 inside. This field can not (yet) be deactivated per manually, but depends on the global on/off status of the base.

[i]Q: Does O2 get lost if i open a hangar door and deactivate the base?[/i]
No. If you deactivate your base, a decompressing sequence is run and all the O2 is moved back into the tanks (if there is enough room. If not, the excess is lost).

[i]Q: Does O2 get lost if someone blasts a hole in may base / If i remove a block thats leading to a hole in the wall?[/i]
A1: IF this is a 'hull breach' to the non-O2 outside world or space either by damage or by removing the 'wrong block' the O2 in the room is lost.
A2: In this case, the Ventilator is not shut down, but it also will not try to refill the room. So no additional O2 is lost after the hull breach happens.

[i]Q: Do players in my base use up the O2 in the tanks?[/i]
A: YES! If you are in your base (helmet off) you and any other player will use up a certain amount of O2 over time (reducing the total amount > T )

[i]Q: Which player armors are currently available?[/i]
Light, Medium, Heavy. If you do not equip any suit, you are still wearing your'Interior Suit'. This one has no protection from Temperature and Radiation, no Jetpack, not booster slots - but also is not limited in movement, jump height and other parameters.

No. You spawn with your last-used player armor equipped.

[i]Q: How do Portals work?[/i]
A1: Just walk up to the Portal and hit F. They will transport you to a instanced playfield that is not part of the solar system by default
A2: If the portal is RED = no destination set or blocked. If the portal is BLUE = portal has a destination.
A3: You can see the destination in the upper right corner of your screen when pointing at the portal!

[i]Q: How do Teleporters work?[/i]
A1: Walk into the Teleporter, face the console and hit F. The transporter will teleport you to the destination he was set to. (Works between playfields. For example orbit<>planet )
A2: You can see the destination of the teleport in the upper right corner of your screen when pointing at the teleporter in front of you!

[i]Q: For builders > How do i set a destination for Portals and Teleporters?[/i]
Open console > activate 'godmode invisble' > face the portal or the teleport and hit F > enter a destination. The destination base needs a teleporter / portal as an exit point!!
A1: Teleporters > IF you want to connect to a destination on the same playfield, just add the name of the target base. IF you want to connect to a destination that is not on the same playfield, just use the base and the playfield, seperated by a : > Example: Outpost:Akua

A2: Portal > If you want to connect your instance, use the base name and the playfield name, seperated by a : as well, where 'playfield' is the instance name in this case.

[i]Q: Can i target a certain teleporter in a specific base on a specifc playfield?[/i]
Of course. Syntax:
[b]Blockname@Basename: Playfield[/b]
Note:
- You can only rename blocks if grouped.
- The 'Basename' is the name of your base as seen ingame in your HUD (not the blueprint-filename or anything else)
- If you want to pre-set the Base-Name when using custom POIs, use the 'Spawn Name' of your blueprint (double-click on the bluprint in your libary to set the spawn-name!)

構造の健全性はどう働く？

English:
Here are a few basic SI rules you need to take into account: 

1. Only blocks that are touching the ground will be 100% stable (does not depend on the material used) 

2. You can only achieve 100% stability for a vertical row of blocks, if the lowest block is touching the ground. If you have a 100% stable block, a so called 'anchor block', you can build a vertical pillar on top of it as high as the sky. There is no vertical limit (yet). 

3. If you add blocks to such a 100% stable pillar in any horizontal direction, so each block that is attached in a row, any additional block will have a lower stability - until the row reaches a breaking point. The maximum range or breaking point for a horizontal, floating, not supported beam made out of any of the four base materials is 12 blocks. Note: The anchor block will keep its stability, as there is no such thing as shear force (yet)! [u]Tip:[/u] if your line or area of blocks is showing weak spots, just build a supporting pillar! 

4. Do not put heavy materials or devices on top of a already weak beam or weak foundation. You might risk the construction to collapse and your devices will be destroyed.

念頭に置いておくべき幾つかの基本ルールがあります:

English:
[i]Q: Which building materials are available in the game?[/i]
You can choose from four different materials: 
- [u]Wood:[/u] easy to acquire in large numbers from all trees (use Chainsaw or Harvester Module), but very low HP and Armor.
- [u]Concrete:[/u] a good and durable alternative to steel and very easy to craft in high numbers. You only need rock dust.
- [u]Steel:[/u] not changed.
- [u]Hardened Steel:[/u] the most durable material in the game, twice the hitpoints compared to steel – but also needs twice the time and resources to produce.

English:
[i]Q: How does the block rotation work?[/i]
You can rotate blocks BEFORE and AFTER you have placed them: 

[u]BEFORE:[/u] If you want to place a new block, you might notice a green line sticking out from the block. This is the ROTATION AXIS. Change with INSERT or DELETE (Default). If you use HOME or END (default), the block will rotate around the Axis line clockwise or counter-clockwise! Use PAGE UP and PAGE DOWN buttons to move the block up and down vertically! 

[u]AFTER:[/u] If you placed a block and would want to rotate it afterwards, you need to equip theMultitool and use its Rotation-Mode (Select via RMB). Aim at a block and you will see the ROTATION AXIS. From here, rotating the block works like when placing a new block (INS/DEL to change Axis, HOME/END to rotate the block).

English:
[i]Q: Can I dock a Small Vessel or a Hover Vessel to a Capital Vessel?[/i]
Yes, but the to-be-docked vessels needs to be in the same faction as the Capital Vessel you want to dock it to. Exception: if the Capital Vessel is set to public, any private vessel can dock.

[i]Q: Can I dock Small Vessel to Small Vessel or Hover Vessel to Small Vessel or Capital Vessel to a Base or any other combination?[/i]
No. Only Small Vessel/Hover Vessel can currently be docked to a Capital Vessel.

[i]Q: How does docking work in particular?[/i]
Your Hover Vessel or Small Vessel either need to be equipped with docking pads or landing gears attached BELOW the vessel corpus. Adding docking pads on the sides or on the top will not dock the vessel to the Capital Vessel! 

Move your Small Vessel or Hover Vessel onto the Capital Vessel. Lower the vessel with C and the Vessel will dock itself. There is no Docking-Key. Just have a look at the info screen on the right. It will show you a 'docked: ' with YES or NO. To undock, just hit SPACE and fly away. 

[u]Note:[/u] 
- Small Vessel and Hover Vessel will not dock to any other blocks than steel or hardened steel. 
 - You cannot dock a Small Vessel or Hover Vessel to a Capital Vessel landing gear!

[i]Q: Do the Capital Vessel landing gears have any use?[/i]
Other than looking cool and absorbing damage from a hard landing? Not yet.

English:
[i]Q: How do I warp with a ship?[/i]
Warping is currently only possible with Capital Vessels. 
1. Add a warp drive and a warp tank to the vessel. Search for the blue crystals, turn them to Pentaxid (in a Constructor) and put them into the warp tank. Each jump will use up a given amount of Pentaxid, but Blue Crystals can be found all over the Solar System. (See Chapter 'Harvesting and Resources') 
2. To do a warp jump, fly to space, open the Space Map (M) and click the Solar System Tab. You will see a list of jump destinations on the left. Select a destination from the left and click on 'LOCK TARGET' on the bottom right. 
3. A blue crosshair will appear in your view or on the side of your helmet. Turn your vessel towards the blue rectangle, accelerate to at least 60m/s and hit K (default) to jump.

[i]Q: Can my passengers take a seat in a docked vessel while warping?[/i]
NO! Your passengers need to take a seat in a passenger seat in your Capital Vessel when warping, when flying to space or back to a planet. Otherwise they might get dropped out and will be left behind.

[i]Q: What are 'triggers'?[/i]
A1: In 6.0 we added a range of sensors that can send a signal to devices, thus changing their operation parameters. For example: pull a lever and have a door closed or a light switched off.

A2: Current triggers / sensors: Trigger plate, Light barrier, Motion sensor, Lever..

[i]Q: Are there different types of sensors?[/i]
A: Yes! The lever has a defined On/Off status. If you move it into ON position, the signal is sent constantly to the device. Most of the other sensors are 'switches'. English:
[i]Q: What can we do with basic triggers / sensors in the moment?[/i]
Basically create simple logics: Activate devices, Open / close devices, Lock / unlock devices. Different devices may offer some, all or a selection of these actions (Depending on what the device can do)

[i]Q: Can i create more complex circuits?[/i]
Yes, see the chapter about SIGNLA LOGIC!

[b]EXAMPLES (for easy sensor-trigger builds)[/b]

= Modes =

1. FOLLOW

Lever: Move handle to ON = ON. OFF = OFF
Switch: Enter the trigger area = ON, Leave the trigger area = OFF

2. TOGGLE
Lever: Do not use with lever (works, but you might need to pull the handle 2x to get an effect)

Switch: Enter and leave the trigger area = switches the status of the device (to ON if OFF, to OFF if ON)

3. ON and OFF
Lever: Do not use (makes no sense)
Switch: sets status of the device to a dedicated ON or OFF status (not using its previous state!) Triggering the trigger again will not have an effect (ON-TIME-change)

= How to SETUP =

1. Place a trigger (lets use a trigger plate)
2. Face the Trigger Plate and hit P
3. If the Trigger Plate is highlighted in CP, you'll notice a new text below the device list: Tx Signal [field]
4. Enter TEST to the field and hit return
5. Place a Light
6. Face the Light and hit P
7. If the Light is highlighted in the CP, you'll notice a new entry ON/OFF as well as two dropdowns and a checkbox with an ' I ' below the device list
7a: Expand the first dropdown and you'll find your TEST command. Select the TEST command to connect the Light to your Trigger Plate
7b: Expand the second dropdown > You can use FOLLOW, TOGGLE, ON and OFF to trigger the Explosives.

Now ...
- IF you want a Player to have the light switched to ON or OFF when he touches the trigger plate, use either ON or OFF
- IF you want the light to switch to OFF if it was ON (or vice versa), use TOGGLE
- IF you want the light to only shine as LONG as the player is on the plate, use FOLLOW
- IF you want the light to dim as LONG as the player is on the plate, use FOLLOW and toggle INVERT ( I checkbox)

English:
[i]Q: Can i trigger several devices from the same sensor?[/i]
YES! Just use the SAME signal name in each of the devices. This way it is possible to - for example - switch a range of lights on or off with only one button/sensor

[i]Q: Can i trigger a device from several sensors?[/i]
Yes, just use SIGNAL LOGICs!

[i]Q: Can i trigger the NPC spawners (for POI design)?[/i]
Yes! Place the NPC spawner and switch it OFF in the Control Panel. Then just connect your sensor. If a player triggers the sensor, the NPCs will be spawned.

[i]Q: Can i trigger the PORTAL (for Instances)?[/i]
Of course!

[i]Q: Can i adjust the range and area of sensors?[/i]
For some sensors like motion sensor and light barrier, this is possible. Just access the sensor (aim at it and hit P) and you'll see its range and a range slider.

[i]Q: Do sensors only trigger for players and vessels?[/i]
A1: Yes, sensors trigger for both player avatars and vessels.
A2: Please note: Motion Sensor and Light Barrier are active as long as a player or vessel is in their field of view. They do NOT deactivate if you just stand still at your position!

[b]Note: Signal Logic is an extention of the Signal/Trigger mechanic, offering new ways on how to connect sensors and triggers in certain, more elaborate ways. Hit the SIGNAL LOGIC button on top of the Control Panel to access.[/b]

[i]Q: What is the purpose of SIGNAL LOGIC circuits?[/i]
They allow you to do things that the standard device-based signal-dropdown would not allow you to do, like connecting different sensors to a several other devices.

[i]Q: How do i use it?[/i]
Pretty much the same as you would set up a sensor-trigger array..but with more paramters/options/gates, like AND, OR, XOR, Inverter, Delays (more planned).

[i]Q: How do i set it up?[/i]
Same as above: Have some sensors placed at your structure. Access them directly or via Control Panel and give them a unique signal name. Then open SIGNAL LOGIC, add a new circuit. Select your sensor signal on the left side. Add a name for the output signal on the right side. Got to the devices that you want to manage with the circuit and add the output signal to your devices signal dropdown.

[i]Q: What are the different gates do?[/i]
AND = All sensors added to the circuit need to trigger for the signal to be send. Example: If you have 2 trigger plates, the light will only be on if both plates are triggeret at the same time (on player standing on each)
OR = If one or more of the added sensors are triggered, the signal is send to the device. Example: A light is illuminated if you stand on of the trigger plates, but also if both plates are triggered.
XOR = sends signal only if only ONE of the two attached sensors is activated. Does not trigger if both sensors are active. Example: the light will only illuminate if exactly one plate is triggered. If both are triggered, no signal is sent and the light remains dark.

INVERTER = inverts the signal (f.ex. to OFF if an ON signal is sent). Example: A light is switched off if you step on a trigger plate. Also ueful when you have two triggers and you need them both to be the same in order to pass an AND gate.
SET/RESET Latch = Use for two sensors: sensor A sets and sensor B resets if triggered.
DELAY = creates a simple delay modificator for a single-signal. Click on the button-box to add a value (seconds)

[i]Q: Can i combine the singals coming from a circuit and use it in a new circuit?[/i]
Of course! Just use the outgoing signal name and select it for the input side. You can create complex circuits this way. Of course you should not delete the underlying circuit for your enhanced circuit or it will break the queue.

English:
[i]Q: How do I spawn a Blueprint / How does the FACTORY work?[/i]
The following applies to a standard Singleplayer- or Multiplayer Survival game. 
1. Open the Blueprint Library (F2). You'll see a list with all of your blueprints on the left and an info panel on the right. 
2. Select a Blueprint from the list and use the button TO FACTORY
3. Add resources to the Factory intake, until all slots of the resource list are green. 
[u]Tip:[/u] You can reduce the waiting time for the blueprint to be finished down to nearly zero if you add more complex blocks like devices instead of ingots! 
[u]Note:[/u] You can NOT remove resources from the factory yet – but you can use it for the next blueprints as the resources are stored. 
4. Start the production and wait. You'll get notified when your blueprint is ready! 
5. If you see the message of your blueprint being finished, open the Blueprint Library again, scroll to the top of the list on the left and select the finished blueprint. 
6. Use the SPAWN button to place the blueprint in the world. 
[u]Tip:[/u] You can move the blueprint wireframe UP and DOWN ahead of placing it! Please have a look in the Options menu to which keys this action is currently bound to (Default: Page Up / Page down). 

[b]Important:[/b] If you playing on a server from different PCs, make sure all of the PCs have the same blueprints available in the /Blueprints folder!

[i]Q: How does saving a game work?[/i]
 There are three ways: 
1. [u]AUTOSAVE:[/u] The game auto-saves every time you leave an ongoing session (ESC -> Door symbol), overwriting the initial savegame. 
2. [u]MANUAL SAVE:[/u] If you hit ESC you'll notice a SAVE button designed like a disk. When you hit the SAVE-button a new savegame will be created with the extension _BACKUP. If you hit the button repeatedly, the _BACKUP extension will get added some numbers
3. [u]COPY SAVE:[/u] From the main menu, open RESUME GAME. Select a savegame and use the COPY button. This will create a manual backup with a _COPY extension. 

[u]Please note:[/u] you cannot load a savegame while in-game, yet.
